page.title: 03Fishing from Westhaven
page.content: Westhaven is a small fishing community east of Carnoustie.A few of the men from the area go out daily to check their creels for crabs and lobsters.These are the main catch for the fishermen.Each week the fish- merchant comes from Arbroath to buy the lobsters and crabs. There are seven small boat sheds at Westhaven but often you can see the creels,boats and nets lying on the shore above the high tide line.This lets the men mend and bait the creels more easily.Fish-heads are used to bait them.The creels are weighted so that they sink to the bottom but they must also have a buoy to mark where the creels are and allow the men to retrieve them. This fishing is done only as a paying hobby.Cod here is caught by the men of the Arbroath fishing industry.
